column4: Greetings fellow ubuntu users, I have a 2 quick questions: firstly i backed up my old harddrive in a single *.tar.gz format, attempting to open the file and extract it is EXTREMELY slow, is there any way to write an index to speed up the process?
You don't have to open it to extract, you can use the command-line
Ah, I see, uh, I think the tar command has some option for that, just a sec
Well to get the list of files all over your hard drive, you can do this: sudo find / | less
